110690760113523563.content:
#100DaysOfCode R2D12

Watched "Premature Optimization" video from CodeAesthetic. Oh man, I want to support this guy's Patreon.

The content and the video editing was so great. 👍

You can check it out here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tKbV6BpH-C8

Also revisit home-row mods for my keymaps.
This time, I followed bingocaller 60% keymaps for navigation layers. Worked well since I'm an ex-vim user. 😏

Also the second nav layer reminds me of my OLKB days. 🥺

https://keymapdb.com/keymaps/bingocaller/

110683072401496366.content:
#100DaysOfCode R2D11

Worked on cleaning up the keymaps repo.

- Some renaming and better comments
- Fix a bug when cp -r creates extra folder if the target folder already exists
- Major improvement on local build process

#TIL that `qmk flash` also builds the firmware before flashing. Even better, I can just use `qmk flash --clean` to get the clean build.

I was doing `build` command before `qmk flash` which do the build twice. It was not optimal, but it's fixed now.

Time to move on! 😅
110683072401496366.parsed_content:
#
100DaysOfCode
 R2D11
Worked on cleaning up the keymaps repo.
- Some renaming and better comments
- Fix a bug when cp -r creates extra folder if the target folder already exists
- Major improvement on local build process
#
TIL
 that `qmk flash` also builds the firmware before flashing. Even better, I can just use `qmk flash --clean` to get the clean build.
I was doing `build` command before `qmk flash` which do the build twice. It was not optimal, but it's fixed now.
Time to move on! 😅

110679116418620719.content:
#100DaysOfCode R2D10

Simplified the build process both locally and on Github actions.
Now I can use the same `just` recipes to build in any environment.

I'm not going to continue working on automatic build pipeline since it will be wasteful on the Billable time. Better keep that for something else.

Tomorrow, I plan to work on refactoring the keymaps repository and then transition to web application projects.

110651003140269610.content:
#100DaysOfCode R2D9

Didn't work on the build pipeline today.

Instead I was implementing my ideal gaming layer for 60% keyboards by utilizing key overrides feature in QMK.

I use `ko_make_with_layers` to enable key override on certain layer only.
Need some recap on bitmask operations today. 😂

It was fun and #TIL that I need to explicitly put KC keys and possibly modifier keys in the target layer otherwise the `ko_make_with_layers` won't work.

110628426804787611.content:
#100DaysOfCode R2D6

- Continue working on improving the pipeline build time
- I tried to use upload/download artifacts to re-use qmk_firmware without having to do `qmk setup` again and again in different matrices/jobs.

Unfortunately, the uploading step took too long. I think tomorrow I need to build my own image and publish it to GitHub Container registry.

My plan is to rebuild the image every quarter to keep the build pipeline stable.

110622885354084764.content:
#100DaysOfCode R2D5

- The result is not great, I couldn't figure out a way to reuse a container from the previous job.

Need to find a way to improve this anyway.

In the worst-case scenario, I will create my own image specifically for this purpose and ensure it is regularly updated with the latest upstream qmk_firmware every month.

I'm determined to overcome these challenges and continue making progress in the second round. Onwards and upwards! 💪🚀

110617175501711917.content:
#100DaysOfCode R2D4

- Fixed artifacts uploading step in the build pipeline
- Utilize GitHub Actions cache

But I feel like the current approach is still not good enough.
There's a cache but each build job has to download the cache.

Maybe setting the pipeline that downloads the cache only once should be much better.

110598541322607163.content:
#100DaysOfCode R2D1

Added #QMK combos to my existing keymaps. Mainly I'd like to add `op` combo for backspace in my Alice layout keyboard only.

However, I ended up enable to feature to all my keyboards.

Also did some refactoring in the old keymaps files. To replace magic numbers with enums (named layers) instead as well as remove the unused layers.

Next, I was planning to do nightly build setup for the keymaps repo.
